channel.description: Recent content in Git on WebstraDev Blog

item.title: GitLab's semi-linear Git history
item.description: Photo by Yancy Min on Unsplash Introduction Working with multiple developers on the same project can often result in messy git histories and unnecessary merge commits when updating feature branches from main. Moreover, merge requests might not be based on the latest version of main when all CI checks pass and manual testing is done. This can result in CI passing on the merge request but failing once merged to main.
